repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
The previous implementation was mostly unaware of the parsing context, whether C types were allowed at all or not. It returned what it found most appropriate. This was often wrong, e.g. for `Optional[float]`, where the Python `float` type is required in order to support None values.

This PR cleans this up and uses a status flag on the current scope to decide whether the analysis happens in a context that allows C types or whether the Python types should be preferred on ambiguity. Compatible types can also switch back and forth along the analysis path, specifically `float` / C `double`, `bool` / `bint` and `complex` / `double complex`. Since there is more than one such type, this equivalence was added to the type system.

See https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/3883

commit.message: Fix some typos in apparently unused code.

Check for "Optional[ctype]" earlier because we need to make sure that "Optional[int]" etc. interprets "int" as (valid) Python int type and not (invalid) C int type.

See https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/3883
Allow any type in dataclasses.InitVar() again.
Fix typing assumptions in PEP 526 variable annotations test: in a Python type annotation, "int" means Python int and "float" means Python float, not the C types.
Make it explicit in annotation type analysis when C types are allowed, and when Python types are required or expected.
Generalise the concept of equivalent Python and C types for more efficient type inference: PyFloat/double, PyBool/bint, PyComplex/double complex.
Use a context manager to handle the "in_c_type_context" state.
Return error type from type specialisation function after reporting a user error.

Refactor analyse_type_annotation() to prepare the extraction of type modifiers (as opposed to special types).

See discussion in https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/4606#issuecomment-1026658869
Refactor handling of "typing.Optional", "dataclasses.InitVar" etc. annotations to move them into the declared Entry during type analysis and keep only the bare type in the type system.

milestone.description:
Goals:
 New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
 Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3`.
 Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
 Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Fix annotation type analysis for Python "typing" types
